name: Udyan Sagar (Nucleya)
bio: Pioneer of desi‑bass EDM; known for Koocha Monster, Bass Rani, Raja Baja. Has performed at EDC Las Vegas, Sunburn, and opened for Skrillex & Major Lazer.

name: Nikhil Sahni (DJ NYK)
bio: Bollywood remix specialist; collaborated with Akon on 'Chammak Challo'; awarded VH1 MyFav ‘Best Hollywood DJ’ multiple times.

name: Chetas Shah (DJ Chetas)
bio: First Indian DJ in DJ Mag Top 100; known for Bollywood mashups and remixes like Baby Ko Bass Pasand Hai, Iqraar By Chance.

name: Anish Sood
bio: Deep‐house/progressive‑house DJ signed to Anjunadeep; supported David Guetta and won MyFav DJ of the Year.

name: DJ Suketu (Suketu Radia)
bio: Renowned Bollywood DJ/producer; hit album 440 Volts; remixed Bin Tere Sanam, Woh Lamhe; collaborated with Flo Rida and Sean Kingston.

name: Ma Faiza
bio: India’s ‘Mother of Electronica’; psychedelic‑trance DJ and queer rights advocate.

name: OG Shez
bio: Mumbai‑based female DJ featured by Mixmag; strong presence in underground and international club scenes.

name: Rhythm Factory Dance Crew
bio: Mumbai‑based troupe specializing in hip‑hop and Bollywood fusion; frequent performers at corporate events and weddings.

name: Blaaze
bio: India’s first hip‑hop artiste in Tamil cinema; known for rap tracks in Slumdog Millionaire and speaking at youth forums.

name: Arijit Singh
bio: One of India’s most celebrated playback singers; known for Tum Hi Ho, Channa Mereya, Kesariya. Winner of numerous Filmfare Awards and conferred Padma Shri in 2025.

name: Shreya Ghoshal
bio: Playback singer with a voice often described as 'billowing silk'; winner of 4 National Awards and 7 Filmfares.

name: Lucky Ali
bio: Indipop legend of the ’90s; known for Sunoh and features on MTV Asia chart for 60 weeks.

name: Sandeep Maheshwari
bio: Renowned motivational speaker and entrepreneur; 27.7M YouTube subscribers; founder of ImageBazaar.

name: Dr. Vivek Bindra
bio: Asia’s top entrepreneurship coach on YouTube (~21M subs) and motivational speaker with multiple Guinness World Records.

name: Gaur Gopal Das
bio: Former IT engineer turned monk and global motivational speaker; author of multiple books like *Life's Amazing Secrets*.

name: BK Shivani
bio: Spiritual mentor and motivational speaker from Brahma Kumaris; 6M+ YouTube subscribers; Nari Shakti awardee.

name: Jay Shetty
bio: Former monk turned global guru; author of bestselling books and host of top podcasts; spoken at Goop Summit.

name: Prakash Iyer
bio: Leadership coach; ex-CEO of IPL team; motivational speaker focusing on teamwork and winning mindset.

name: Sadhguru (Jaggi Vasudev)
bio: Yogic mystic, founder of Isha Foundation, bestselling author, and global speaker at world forums.

name: Chetan Bhagat
bio: Bestselling author and youth motivational speaker; formerly investment banker; hosts workshops across campuses.

name: DJ Shadow Dubai
bio: International DJ and music producer; collaborated with Pitbull, Sean Paul; performed across major global festivals.

name: MJ5
bio: Award-winning all-male dance group known for moonwalk style and robotic choreography; India’s Got Talent finalists.

name: V Company
bio: Winners of Dance Plus Season 1; known for massive synchronized troupe acts with over 50 members.

name: Desi Hoppers
bio: Winners of World of Dance 2015; fusion of Indian and western street styles; featured on Ellen Show.

name: Kings United India
bio: World champions at World Hip Hop Dance Championship 2019; India’s leading hip-hop crew.

name: House of Suraj
bio: Los Angeles-based whacking/voguing troupe with Indian roots; featured in Step Up: Year of the Dance.

name: Rimi Tomy Dance Crew
bio: South India–based fusion crew; known for mixing classical with cinematic dance for stage shows.

name: TDA – The Dance Addicts
bio: YouTube-famous troupe specializing in dance covers and wedding choreographies; trained by Terence Lewis alumni.

name: Neha Kakkar
bio: Bollywood hit machine; known for Kala Chashma, Garmi, and more; top streaming female artist in India.

name: Jubin Nautiyal
bio: Soothing playback voice behind hits like Tum Hi Aana, Kaabil Hoon, and Lut Gaye; Filmfare winner.

name: Badshah
bio: Rap superstar and hitmaker of songs like DJ Waley Babu, Genda Phool; top performer in college fests.

name: Jonita Gandhi
bio: Classically trained Indo‑Canadian singer; popular for The Breakup Song, Gilehriyaan, and Coke Studio performances.

name: Armaan Malik
bio: Young Bollywood sensation; voice of Bol Do Na Zara, Butta Bomma; multilingual global performer.
